item.title: Basic Pest Control System! [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

Why don’t you use Graham’s EventManager instead of process()?

p.s.
In this segment the PestControl reference should be camelCase.

item.title: Basic Pest Control System! [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

halflive9:

Good job Clawz I like it that people still are releasing things for delta . Maybe for a next time u can find out how to add the monsters and make them actual attack the void knight

Lol, I already know how to add the monsters and what not, although for them to attack the knight you would need NpcVsNpc Combat.
I just haven’t added them because I made this back when I was doing Rune-Warfare with Aj, and I was stupid back then and didn’t know how to add NpcVsNpc Combat.
Thanks though.

item.title: Basic Pest Control System! [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Owner Zachs, post:26, topic:386377”]I got this error

[code]PestControl.java:51: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable toX
location: class client
c.toX = inGameX + misc.random(1);
^
PestControl.java:52: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable toY
location: class client
c.toY = inGameY + misc.random(3);
^
PestControl.java:53: cannot find symbol
symbol : method spawnANPC(int,int,int,int)
location: class NPCHandler
server.npcHandler.spawnANPC(3777, 2628, 2591,0);

                                             ^

PestControl.java:54: cannot find symbol
symbol : method spawnANPC(int,int,int,int)
location: class NPCHandler
server.npcHandler.spawnANPC(3778, 2680, 2588,0);

                                             ^

PestControl.java:55: cannot find symbol
symbol : method spawnANPC(int,int,int,int)
location: class NPCHandler
server.npcHandler.spawnANPC(3779, 2669, 2570,0);

                                             ^

PestControl.java:56: cannot find symbol
symbol : method spawnANPC(int,int,int,int)
location: class NPCHandler
server.npcHandler.spawnANPC(3780, 2645, 2569,0);

                                             ^

PestControl.java:76: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable pcPoints
location: class client
c.pcPoints++;
^
PestControl.java:77: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable toX
location: class client
c.toX = endGameX;
^
PestControl.java:78: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable toY
location: class client
c.toY = endGameY;
^
PestControl.java:86: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable pcPoints
location: class client
c.sM(“You have defeated pest control! You now ha
ve “+c.pcPoints+” points!”);

  ^

PestControl.java:86: cannot find symbol
symbol : method sM(java.lang.String)
location: class client
c.sM(“You have defeated pest control! You now ha
ve “+c.pcPoints+” points!”);
^
PestControl.java:179: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable toX
location: class client
c.toX = endGameX;
^
PestControl.java:180: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable toY
location: class client
c.toY = endGameY;
^
PestControl.java:184: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable pcPoints
location: class client
c.sendQuest(" “+c.pcPoints+”", 1037
9);
^
PestControl.java:273: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable actionInterval
location: class client
if(System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastAc
tion > c.actionInterval)

    ^

PestControl.java:275: cannot find symbol
symbol : method sM(java.lang.String)
location: class client
c.sM(“You enter the boat, “+wait
Timer+” till next game startserver.”);
^
PestControl.java:276: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable toX
location: class client
c.toX = 2660;
^
PestControl.java:277: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable toY
location: class client
c.toY = 2639;
^
PestControl.java:278: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable actionInterval
location: class client
c.actionInterval = 2500;
^
PestControl.java:284: cannot find symbol
symbol : method sM(java.lang.String)
location: class client
c.sM(“You leave the boat.”);
^
PestControl.java:285: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable toX
location: class client
c.toX = 2657;
^
PestControl.java:286: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable toY
location: class client
c.toY = 2639;
^
PestControl.java:301: cannot find symbol
symbol : method sM(java.lang.String)
location: class client
c.sM(“You cannot do this action!”);
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
23 errors
Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .[/code][/quote]
facepalm You aren’t using Delta, all Delta’s have those methods.

[quote=“Halflingblade, post:28, topic:386377”]Now that I’ve done a lot of updates on my server and came around to it, I decided to add a basic pest control system. I noticed the coding above and it looks like the pc minigame where you attack portals. Would this work if I used it on my dodian base as long as I have a client with the new models?

Edit: One more question, do you have a tutorial with monsters involved? Or just portals.[/quote]
It’s basic, just portals, I’ll update when I feel inclined to do so.
If you feel like you want to do it then go ahead, it shouldn’t be hard.

Read full topic

@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Owner Zachs, post:23, topic:386377”]ALRIGHT THANKS NOW I GET THIS ERROR

client.java:33: illegal start of expression
public PestControl PestControl = new PestControl(this);
^
client.java:35: illegal start of expression
public PestControl getPC()
^
client.java:35: ‘;’ expected
public PestControl getPC()
^
3 errors
Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]
You didn’t add the constructor in the right place.

Add it right under:

‘public class client extends Player implements Runnable {’

item.title: Basic Pest Control System! [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Owner Zachs:

How do i make it a Java? my only choices are Save as all files and Text Document.

Use ‘Save as…’

Then click ‘all files’

Then save it as ‘PestControl.java’ << Save it exactly how I typed it.

Or you can always copy and paste another Java file and rename it.

Read full topic

item.title: Basic Pest Control System! [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

how i can get to the pest control ?? in port sarim dont are void knight !

Are you kidding me?

If you want the Pest Control knight to be at Port Sarim and teleport you, you have to program it yourself. Don’t just expect everything to be there like freaking Runescape.

Read full topic

item.title: Basic Pest Control System! [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @glestrts glestrts
item.description:
@glestrts wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Or we could use switch()?

switch (npcs[i].npcType) { case 3777: temp.getPC().portal1 = true; break; case 3778: temp.getPC().portal2 = true; break; case 3779: temp.getPC().portal3 = true; break; case 3780: temp.getPC().portal4 = true; break; } temp.getPC().checkPc();[/quote]
You do realize that with the advice you just gave you will be checking for a pest control victory every 600 ms for every single npc right?

Read full topic

item.title: Basic Pest Control System! [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Kaex, post:10, topic:386377”][code]
/**
** Handles timers
**
**/

            public void process() 
            {
                    if(waitTimer == 0)
                    {
                            waitTimer = 300;
                            initializePc();
                            updatePanel();
                    }
                    if(waitTimer > 0)
                    {
                            waitTimer -= 1;
                            updatePanel();
                    }
            }

[/code]

No need to hammer things into the process method also…

Else if would have been more suitable.

               /**
                ** Handles timers
                ** 
                **/

                public void process() 
                {
                        if(waitTimer == 0)
                        {
                                waitTimer = 300;
                                initializePc();
                                updatePanel();

                        } else if (waitTimer > 0) {
                                waitTimer -= 1;
                                updatePanel();
                        }
                }

Also just out of curiousity:

               /**
                **
                ** 
                **/

Why do your documentation like that, looks weird to me

One last thing, your creating multiple if statements, try use the else if for example.

if (npcs[i].npcType == 3777) 
{
        temp.getPC().portal1 = true;
        temp.getPC().checkPc(); 
}
if (npcs[i].npcType == 3778) 
{
        temp.getPC().portal2 = true;
        temp.getPC().checkPc();
}
if (npcs[i].npcType == 3779) 
{
        temp.getPC().portal3 = true;
        temp.getPC().checkPc();
}
if (npcs[i].npcType == 3780) 
{
        temp.getPC().portal4 = true;
        temp.getPC().checkPc();
}

Could be:

if (npcs[i].npcType == 3777) 
{
        temp.getPC().portal1 = true;
        temp.getPC().checkPc(); 
 
} else if (npcs[i].npcType == 3778) {
        temp.getPC().portal2 = true;
        temp.getPC().checkPc();
} else if (npcs[i].npcType == 3779) {
        temp.getPC().portal3 = true;
        temp.getPC().checkPc();
} else if (npcs[i].npcType == 3780) {
        temp.getPC().portal4 = true;
        temp.getPC().checkPc();
}

Other than that, great job man.[/quote]
Yeah, if I had written this now, I definitely would have used event manager for the timers, as process timers are extremely inaccurate.

Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Basic Pest Control System! [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @Kaex Kaex
item.description:
@Kaex wrote:

               /**
                ** Handles timers
                ** 
                **/

                public void process() 
                {
                        if(waitTimer == 0)
                        {
                                waitTimer = 300;
                                initializePc();
                                updatePanel();
                        }
                        if(waitTimer > 0)
                        {
                                waitTimer -= 1;
                                updatePanel();
                        }
                }

No need to hammer things into the process method also…

Else if would have been more suitable.

               /**
                ** Handles timers
                ** 
                **/

                public void process() 
                {
                        if(waitTimer == 0)
                        {
                                waitTimer = 300;
                                initializePc();
                                updatePanel();

                        } else if (waitTimer > 0) {
                                waitTimer -= 1;
                                updatePanel();
                        }
                }

Also just out of curiousity:

               /**
                **
                ** 
                **/

Why do your documentation like that, looks weird to me

One last thing, your creating multiple if statements, try use the else if for example.

if (npcs[i].npcType == 3777) 
{
        temp.getPC().portal1 = true;
        temp.getPC().checkPc(); 
}
if (npcs[i].npcType == 3778) 
{
        temp.getPC().portal2 = true;
        temp.getPC().checkPc();
}
if (npcs[i].npcType == 3779) 
{
        temp.getPC().portal3 = true;
        temp.getPC().checkPc();
}
if (npcs[i].npcType == 3780) 
{
        temp.getPC().portal4 = true;
        temp.getPC().checkPc();
}

Could be:

if (npcs[i].npcType == 3777) 
{
        temp.getPC().portal1 = true;
        temp.getPC().checkPc(); 
 
} else if (npcs[i].npcType == 3778) {
        temp.getPC().portal2 = true;
        temp.getPC().checkPc();
} else if (npcs[i].npcType == 3779) {
        temp.getPC().portal3 = true;
        temp.getPC().checkPc();
} else if (npcs[i].npcType == 3780) {
        temp.getPC().portal4 = true;
        temp.getPC().checkPc();
}

Other than that, great job man.

item.title: Basic Pest Control System! [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“glestrts, post:8, topic:386377”]Doesn’t look completely bad, may I ask why you are putting npc dying in process? Why wouldn’t you just put it in the drop item method?

EDIT: Someone might take the wrong idea from that. I mean the code put in the process method of NpcHandler.java[/quote]
Because I made this a long time ago; can’t be assed to update.

Read full topic
